metadata.Title: CVE-2016-10542 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
ws is a "simple to use, blazing fast and thoroughly tested websocketclient, server and console for node.js, up-to-date against RFC-6455". Bysending an overly long websocket payload to a `ws` server, it is possibleto crash the node process. This affects ws 1.1.0 and earlier.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10542` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

node-ws - 1.1.0+ds1.e6ddaae4-5
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: node-ws package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.1.0+ds1.e6ddaae4-5').
